results.title: Maya of Ancient and Modern Yucatan
results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Evans, Guy Haselton and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: The discoveries of archaeologists shows the high degree of civilization attained by the Maya people centuries ago. The Maya developed their own system of hieroglyphic writing and astronomers devised a calendar. A few Yucatecans still live in thatched huts, but most now live in modern cities. New industries are being researched and developed; transport systems improved; and greater emphasis placed on education. A new civilization is growing in this ancient land.

results.title: May wedding
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The wedding of H.R.H. Princess Margaret with Mr Antony Armstrong-Jones in Westminster Abbey on 6th May 1960. Records the enthusiasm and celebrations of the London crowds. Follows the Princess from her home at Clarence House, through the solemnity and splendour of the marriage ceremony, back with her bridegroom along the processional route to Buckingham Palace, and out from the Port of London in the Royal Yacht “Britannia” on the first stage of the Caribbean honeymoon. Commentary by Michael Redgrave.

results.title: Maximum security
results.creator_credit: Mark Stiles and Prisoners' Action Group
results.brief_description: This film describes life in the “intractable” section of a maximum security jail based on prisoners’ actual accounts. The “tracs” sections are notorious jails inside the jails, totally isolated from the outside world and beyond the reach of the law and of public scrutiny. A work funded through the Experimental Film and Television Fund.

results.title: Maximum effort
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “War in the Air”.
The beginning of Britain’s strategic air bombardment of Germany, related to its effect on the German war effort, Spring, 1941-Spring 1942. Title music by Sir Arthur Bliss. Music for this film by Malcolm Arnold.

results.title: Max Stephens talks about frameworks
results.brief_description: Max Stephens addresses a meeting at Horsham in June 1987 to explain the stage of development that the Curriculum frameworks project had then reached. The program outlines the basis and approach to learning emphasised by the Frameworks project and also looks at the implementation of tasks. No other credits available.

results.title: Max's Christmas (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne, Michael Sporn, Michael Sporn Animation and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Ruby can’t get her little brother Max to go to sleep on Christmas Eve, and the fun begins as Max sneaks downstairs hoping to see Santa. Based on the book of the same title by Rosemary Wells. Voices: Jenny Agutter and Rex Robbins.

results.title: Mawson Base: face to face
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Rob McCubbin, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production
results.brief_description: Shot mainly around the Mawson area and narrated by Dr Phillip Law, this film looks at Antartica through the eyes of the expedition’s cook and the doctor. Raises issues on the future of Antartica and gives insight into the daily pressures of life in isolation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mavis goes to Timor
results.creator_credit: Catherine Marciniak, Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
86 year old Mavis Taylor travels from Yarrawonga to East Timor on her first trip overseas. Against the odds, she plans to establish a sewing co-operative for the local women. Frustrated by bureaucracy, Mavis seeks assistance from the local community to help her transform an abandoned hospital into a warehouse and training centre for the co-operative. Her determination and perseverance is rewarded when the first order arrives and a group of local women are trained and organised to meet the delivery deadline. The project provides an opportunity for the women to establish economic security and independence for themselves and their community. During her stay in East Timor, Mavis also visits a church whose congregation was massacred by the Indonesian militia. Cinematography by Catherine Marciniak. Edited by Andrea Lang. Narrated by Anne Phelan.

results.title: Maurice Sendak
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A visit to Maurice Sendak in his studio apartment, where he speaks of his favourite composers, expresses his admiration for painters and illustrators of the past, tells how these artists have influenced his own work, and traces the development of the book ‘Where the Wild Things Are’.

results.title: Mau Mau. Black man's land: images of colonialism and independance in Kenya
results.brief_description: Images of colonialism and independence in Kenya. A statement on British colonial policy in Kenya, the colony in British East Africa with the largest white population. Deals with the period from 1952 - 1957, when the “Mau Mau” were operating. Narrated by an African whose tone is bitter, the film looks at the Mau Mau from a different point of view.
